body_html: Ping on this PR. Would it be adequate if I wrote a test scenario that exhibited the failure if the hardware were such that it would exhibit the bug? Or I can potentially write a simulated test, that uses a very simple neural network, and intercepts the cuda calls to reproduce a similar issue in pure software (no GPU involvement), but that would have the drawback that we're not actually demonstrating a problem. I'm hoping for some direction, what can I do to help this get approved? There don't seem to be any existing tests in the caffe2 python layer that are close to where they'd need to be to demonstrate an issue like this.
